sen.e: In the Sengoku period (Japan), the family line failed once in the generation of Tadafuyu TAKATSUKASA, but in the early Edo period Nobufusa TAKATSUKASA, son of Haruyoshi NIJO, restored the House of Takatsukasa, which continued to exist until the modern age.

sen.j: 江戸後期から幕末にかけて鷹司家の当主が関白を務める機会が多く、特に鷹司政通は30年余りにわたって関白を務めた。
sen.e: From the late Edo period to the end of the Edo Shogunate period, the family heads of the House of Takatsukasa frequently became senior regent, and in particular Masamichi TAKATSUKASA served as senior regent over thirty years.

sen.j: また、信房の娘の鷹司孝子が徳川家光の正室となったことから、弟である鷹司信平は、鷹司松平家を名乗ることが許され、天皇に仕える公家から、徳川家の旗本へと転身した、この武家の鷹司家は、代を重ねるごとに加増され、最終的には上野国吉井藩主家となった。
sen.e: Because Takako TAKATSUKASA, daughter of Nobufusa, became a legitimate wife of Iemitsu TOKUGAWA, her younger brother Nobuhira TAKATSUKASA was allowed to call himself as the House of Takatsukasa-Matsudaira and he changed his social status from a court noble who served the Emperor to Hatamoto, a direct vassal of the shogun, of Tokugawa Family; this House of Takatsukasa, a samurai family, had been promoted over generations and ultimately became the house of the lord of the domain of Yoshii, the Province of Kozuke.
